thread.title: Aerosmith frontman asks Trump campaign to stop using song
thread.title_full: Aerosmith frontman asks Trump campaign to stop using song - San Francisco Chronicle

title: Aerosmith frontman asks Trump campaign to stop using song
text: Photo: Jordan Strauss, Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP FILE - In this Friday, Nov. 14, 2014, file photo, Steven Tyler arrives at the Hollywood Film Awards at the Palladium, in Los Angeles. Aerosmith frontman Tyler is asking Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump to stop using the power ballad "Dream On" at campaign events. (Photo by Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP, File) FILE - In this Friday, Nov. 14, 2014, file photo, Steven Tyler... LOS ANGELES (AP) — Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler is asking Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump to stop using the power ballad "Dream On" at campaign events. FILE - In this Friday, Nov. 14, 2014, file photo, Steven Tyler arrives at the Hollywood Film Awards at the Palladium, in Los Angeles. Aerosmith frontman Tyler is asking Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump to stop using the power ballad "Dream On" at campaign events. (Photo by Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP, File) FILE - In this Friday, Nov. 14, 2014, file photo, Steven Tyler... LOS ANGELES (AP) — Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler is asking Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump to stop using the power ballad "Dream On" at campaign events.
